column4: anyone know about mod_proxy? there's no package for it in the repo...
it's included by default on apache2 -- you just need to enable it (IIRC) .. use a2enmod
he wants to have full access over /var/www/ remotely
okay, then if he can't do it remotely, then he can't do it locally either (I know you guys know this)
ahh, no, this is from nautilus-connect-server .. not really X over ssh
what the heck is that? O_o I think I'm going back to kubuntu
ahh, i forgot you're a KDE user -- it's errm, a utility that mounts remote shares locally
so basically, it's a sftp client (i think)
so he can't sudo at all into the other system...
that makes sense... I have to copy the stuff with sftp and the sudo ssh move them
errm, not with this utility nope.. it's purely for filesystem access
well, thats exactly what we're trying to avoid -- get the user he uses to log in remotely a member of the group that owns the directory
